data.text:
Meet our Design Team!

Jessica Frost-Ballas,

Design Team and Social Media Coordinator

Hi, I‚Äôm Jess from All the Sparkle! I live in the Shenandoah Valley of Virginia with my incredibly supportive husband, three sassy cats, and a goofy sheltie! I discovered Chibitronics in 2015 and fell head over heels! I love interactive cards and adding a light-up element is just the perfect way to create something truly special for a loved one! I am honored to work for several amazing paper-crafting companies and enjoy incorporating Chibitronics products with their designs! I look forward to sharing lots of interactive card ideas with you!

Instagram

Youtube

Facebook

Blog

Edna Abreu

A passionate content creator and entrepreneur, Edna has taken the digital world by storm through her vibrant YouTube channel, EdnasKrafts. With almost 100,000 subscribers or as she calls them ‚Äúcreative hands‚Äù, Edna has become a prominent figure in the universe of crafting and the creation of crafts. Since the launch of EdnasKrafts, this visionary has been dedicated to showing how modern tools can help start a business from home. Her unique approach not only focuses on creating art, but also how to turn these skills into a creative and fun business. With passion for crafting and an innate ability to teach, Edna has built a welcoming community where any creative hand can hone their techniques. Her channel is a treasure trove of tutorials, innovative ideas, and tool reviews, providing her followers with the knowledge needed to boost the talent in their hands. Edna has proven that creativity has no limits and can be a powerful tool in forging a unique path to success. Join Edna on her exciting creative journey and discover how art meets entrepreneurship in an entertaining way.

Instagram

YouTube

Tiktok

Facebook

Rana Alo

Hi, my name is Rana and I live in Germany. I‚Äôm 31 years old, a wife, and Mom for a sweet boy. I‚Äôm a civil engineer and illustrator. My cardmaking journey started 4 years ago when I wanted to create some cards to give them to our friends when my son was born. Since then I started to search and learn more about cardmaking and I discovered the interactive cards and the lights up cards and I started to combine them to create some special cards that can make everyone‚Äôs day better. l always love to try new things and new techniques on my handmade projects and I like to introduce my engineering skills into it. My favourite part is sharing my ideas with people and inspiring them.

Jenn Cascell

Hi! I‚Äôm Jenn and I‚Äôm so happy to be joining the team. I live in western NY with my husband and our posse of fluffy cats. I have been paper crafting for over 20 years and I love creating everything from cards to mini albums and everything in between. I cannot wait to share my creations with you!

Kathy Ceceri

Hi! I‚Äôm Kathy and my passion is creating STEAM learning activities for kids and teens using crafts materials and household supplies! I‚Äôve written over a dozen books including Paper Inventions, BOTS, and Making Simple Robots that introduce electronics basics with light-up origami and other fun projects. I firmly believe in the intersection of art and engineering, and love helping techy kids get crafty (and vice versa). When not teaching, writing, or checking out social media for new project ideas, I can be found hiking, biking, and kayaking along the Hudson River in upstate NY. I‚Äôm the proud mom of a video game developer and a filmmaker.

Emily Clabau

I‚Äôm 45 years old and I live in Roeselare (Belgium). I‚Äôm the mom of 3 teenagers. I love to craft and have been a Cricut Ambassador for Belgium and the Netherlands since December 2022 (so I speak Dutch and French, too!) I love making all kinds of crafts and inspire others with the things I make.

Instagram

Allison Cope

Hi! My name is Allison Cope. My little family of three live in Southern Alberta, Canada. I have been a crafter for the past 17 years. My favorite medium is Copic Markers and I love making interactive cards. I can‚Äôt wait to share my creations with you!

Instagram

YouTube

Blog

Jill Dawson

My name is Jill and I am an educator, artist, and maker who lives in Vermont (with my husband of 28 years). While I‚Äôm no longer a classroom teacher, I remain passionate about learning and sharing ideas with others. A firm believer in the power of experimentation and play, I am drawn to paper and electronics. One of my favorite things to do is figure out ways to add light to handmade book structures, pop ups, and mechanical cards. I also enjoy traveling, eating maple ice cream with my daughter, and taking walks in the woods.

Melissa Goodman

Hi, My name is Melissa and I live in the Blue Mountains, Australia with my supportive Husband and 2 boys. I started card making in the early 1990‚Äôs and love to colour with Copic Markers. I am excited to be on the Design Team and hope to inspire you with my fun and interactive cards using Chibitronics Products.

YouTube

Blog

Hello Play!

Hello Play! is the collective effort of friends and colleagues Mariana, Andrea, and Celeste to spark curiosity, play, and creativity for learners of all ages. Together, we bring together our multidisciplinary experiences in design, STEAM, and education to create projects and experiences that are equal parts joyful and educational.

Instagram

Kenzie Housego

Multidisciplinary artist Kenzie Housego‚Äôs practice includes textiles, embroidery, new-media, and assemblage mediums. The use of technology such as LEDs, Arduino micro-controllers, texting, and screens within her research is symbolic of the virtual realms in which we participate as a society. Her recent series ‚ÄúI‚ù§U‚Äù combines craft and technology to explores contemporary courtship, technology, and historical signs and signifiers connected to dating and romance. Housego‚Äôs artwork often offers an invitation for interactivity, encouraging viewers to shift from passive observers to active co-producers as they engage with the digital media, experiencing other points of view, and ultimately forming their own individual meanings. Housego holds an MFA from the University of Calgary and a BFA from the Alberta University of the Arts. She has exhibited her art nationally and internationally, notably at the Art Gallery of Alberta, Edmonton, CURRENTS festival, Santa Fe New Mexico, and Curiosity Festival, Dublin, Ireland.

Instagram

YouTube

Blog

Yukiko Inami

Hi, everyone! I‚Äôm Yukiko Inami. I live in Japan. I have three daughters and a husband. I have loved crafts, stationery goods and writing letters to friends since I was little. I started card making about 12 years ago at a volunteer group. It‚Äôs the best combination of my favorite things!! After that, I focused on it. Card making has brought many new friends and the Instagram world to me. If you have some experiences that you tried to use Chibitronics in your project and it didn‚Äôt work, we are similar. I‚Äôll show you not only my beautiful work but also examples from my failed experiences to learn from!

YouTube

Sally Kong

Sally is a software engineer, artist, and educator based in Brooklyn, NY. For the past 6 years, she has built artist tools and pipelines for feature animation and games. Her creative practice involves fusing technology with traditional crafts to translate patterns from living systems into familiar forms.

Instagram

Jessica Lin

Hello crafty friends! My name is Jessica Lin. I am a crafty gal in my late twenties, but my passion for cardmaking started a long time ago when I was 9. I was introduced to wooden stamps and I haven‚Äôt stopped stamping since. Some of my other hobbies include sewing, washi tape collaging, and I hope one day I‚Äôll learn how to crochet, too. I grew up in Taiwan and speak Mandarin as my mother tongue, so my YouTube channel is mostly filmed in Chinese. This year, I decided to create a bilingual Instagram account. If you are inspired by bold, vibrant colors and enjoy detailed projects with lots of layers, come have a visit! I look forward to meeting and crafting with all of you!

Instagram

YouTube

Christy Matte

I‚Äôm Christy. I‚Äôm a maker/crafter/artist who loves technology and gadgets, baking, reading, playing video games, spontaneous journeys, and watching too much TV. I am a passionate lifelong learner and creative dabbler, but I am particularly enamored with paper arts like bookbinding and marbling. I hold an M.Ed. in Technology in Education, which may help explain my habit of bringing people together to connect, learn, create, and play. I live in Massachusetts with my husband, two teens, a clingy cat, and a revolving door of foster pets.

Instagram

Blog

Monica Moody

Hi, I‚Äôm Monica Moody; an artist and graphic designer living in Dallas, Texas with my husband, a couple of kids, a couple of pets, and way more than a couple of crafty interests. For me, the magic is in combining concepts and materials from multiple disciplines ‚Äì the more included, the better! I especially enjoy mixing techniques and elements that may seem unusual together. For the past several years, I have worked mostly with fiber and textiles. It was actually a sewing project that led me to Chibitronics! Now I am having a blast lighting up my makes with paper (and plastic, and fabric!) circuits and LED lights. I‚Äôm excited to add more interactivity to my projects and to share ideas with you!

Instagram

Tiktok

Laura Nistal

Hello! My name is Laura, I‚Äôm from Argentina but I‚Äôve been living in Spain for 21 years, very near to Barcelona. Since I was little I have always liked stationery and crafts, but it was in 2017 when I started this hobby professionally. I am a teacher in the mornings and a crafter in the afternoons, I love creating cards and you will see that I use a lot of color in all of them! I am fascinated by interactive cards, whether they are shakers, sliders or lights, and when I discovered Chibitronics I couldn‚Äôt resist! I really like to share my projects on social networks and that you can find inspiration. I can‚Äôt wait to show you my projects with Chibitronics!

Instagram

Melisa Noziere

Hello! I‚Äôm Melisa Noziere, a born and raised New Yorker with a passion for technology and making. As a K-12 Technology Integration Specialist, I am constantly on the lookout for innovative tools that can enhance learning experiences. That‚Äôs when I stumbled upon Chibitronics, and I couldn‚Äôt resist diving into the world of light-up paper circuits. Chibitronics has become my go-to for bringing creativity, innovation and technology together in the classroom. As a maker, I love exploring the endless possibilities that Chibitronics offers, creating projects that not only captivate my students but also inspire fellow educators.

Eileen Ong

I‚Äôm Eileen, a dedicated card maker from Singapore üá∏üá¨. Embracing the world of crafts, I ventured into scrapbooking in 2001, turning it into a cherished hobby. It wasn‚Äôt until 2018 that I started sharing my artistic journey, particularly focusing on cards, on Instagram. Crafting cards has become a therapeutic endeavour for me, and I find great joy in seeing the smiles on the faces of my loved ones and friends when they receive my heartfelt creations.

Instagram

Blog

Sarah Phelan

Hi, I‚Äôm Sarah from Sarah‚Äôs Stampin‚Äô Retreat! I live in London with my partner and son. I‚Äôve been a crafter since I was tiny, but really turned to cardmaking as an adult because I LOVE that you can create a complete project in one session and that there are so many different techniques to learn ‚Äì I‚Äôm still learning new things 20 years later! I‚Äôm so excited to have the opportunity to be on the Chibitronics team and to share my makes with you all!

Instagram

YouTube

Blog

Facebook

Auna Quinonez

Hey, I‚Äôm Auna from Made by Auna. I live in Reno, Nevada with my husband who I‚Äôve been with for fifteen years and our awesome two kids. We also have three dogs. I‚Äôm a stay-at-home mom who started crafting in the summer of 2021 and I started working with paper crafts in 2022 and have loved every second of it. I love to incorporate lights into my paper crafts including cake toppers and 3D letters and I look forward to learning all about the world of Chibitronics. Adding lights to paper crafts adds a really cool design element and takes your crafts to the next level. I feel very honored and privileged to be able to work with different design teams and learn and continue growing. I‚Äôm looking forward to sharing new and different ways to incorporate Chibitronics into my crafts and show you all the possibilities the crafting world has.

Facebook

Tiktok

Irina Rymshina

Irina Rymshina is a Professor of Entrepreneurship and Innovation at the International MBA Program of ESAN Graduate School of Business. Founder of Moonshotkidz, a Startup in ideation stage currently producing arts, crafts and content on DIY electronics, STEAM and science activities for beginners. She graduated in economics from the Russian University of Cooperation with specialization in Finance and Credit and a Master‚Äôs in Business Administration with a major in IT Management from ESAN University. Former IT Operations Manager in Peru for Softline Group, a global software and computer solutions corporation with operations in over 24 countries and annual sales of over USD 500 million. Former Project Manager for Holosens, a Startup incubator and company builder. Alumnus of the Graduate Studies Program at Singularity University in Silicon Valley, where she incubated the Startup HOOPE, an affordable, easy to use medical device. Hoope was selected by Startup Mexico and Startup Chile receiving USD 75,000 in equity-free seed capital. In November 2014, Irina delivered the winning pitch at the World Startup Competition in Korea, receiving the USD 20,000 Google-Dcamp Prize after competing with top startups from more than 45 countries around the world. Irina started her career as executive economist at ABS Group, an Eastern European multinational holding with over 5000 employees, providing comprehensive solutions and executing mega projects globally.

Arjita Singh

My name is Arjita Singh and I am from India. I love colouring, stamping and DIY the most. I have been crafting and painting since childhood, but I was introduced to the world of stamping and card making in 2012. Ever since then I have been very lucky to have worked with few of the best names in the crafting industry and I just want to keep learning, inspiring, and creating cards every day.

Hi there! I‚Äôm Sasha, a cardmaker and crafter from Ontario, Canada. Although I have always been crafty, I discovered my love for paper crafting in early 2020 (and cardmaking a little bit later), and I have not looked back since! I love sharing my creations online, so I look forward to sharing my crafty projects with all of you!

I started my crafting journey with vinyl and later found the love for paper crafting, I enjoy working with different techniques and super excited to be joining Chibitronics Design Team! Join me in this new crafting journey, can‚Äôt wait to share my creations with you.

Eiko Uchida

Hello there, I am Eiko Uchida and I am super excited to be joining with Chibitronics Design Team! I live in Japan with my husband. I am an office worker by day and I enjoy crafting by night. I love experimenting with new products and techniques. After meeting Chibitronics in April of 2016, I became a Chibitronics addict.

Hello! I‚Äôm Traci from Traci Vanover Designs. I live in the Midwest, along with my husband and our two Yorkshire Terriers. I am a graphic designer, creator, instructor, DIY‚Äôer and all-round mischief maker. I love that working with Chibitronics will add an unexpected and unique element to my projects, and I look forward to sharing them with you!
